page.title: 20THE AREA-Steep to Hawkley 2
page.content: The extent of the activity can be seen in the various strata that are visible in the scarp along its length. Dotted around the area are many small copses. Being on chalk,there are many springs & streams and in the clay ground below the scarp, marshes. The highest point in the district is about 250m above sea level-the lowest about 75m. South of the scarp, tucked away in the folds beneath the hangers lie many secluded houses-among them Ashford Chace- built in the mid 19th century as the gentry moved into the area.It's always been (& still is) a popular spot for Naval officers to live in & retire to(Ports- -mouth is not far away) & several were built for this reason.Elsewhere, old buildings are often of brick & timber frame construction-tiled or thatched- and some are of considerable age & interest.Come & see for yourself....
